content:
Does it feel like there's too much whitespace at the bottom of the compose box to anyone else?

image.png
If you're going for more compactness, yes. However, if I was using Zulip UI from a touchscreen, I'd appreciate the extra pixels inset from the bottom of the touchscreen.
Hmm, yeah, we may want special touchscreen CSS for that corner case.

The main problem is consistency. The Subscribe to more streams in the left sidebar, buttons on the left side of the compose box, Press Enter to send on the right side of the compose box, Invite more users in the right sidebar, and the keyboard shortcuts icon in the corner are aligned to five different distances from the bottom.

Hear hear Anders Kaseorg. I like the visibility of the Keyboard Shortcuts icon, however it still feels out of place being anchored to the compose container. It sticks out like a sore thumb when you CTRL+SCROLL_DOWN before the USERS pane refreshes with more users.
The Subscribe to more streams is appended to the Stream list and just happens be near the compose container due to the number of streams.

Subscribe to more streams is also impacted by Zoom In/Out and if zoomed, it gets pinned to the bottom portion of the screen, out of alignment with the compose box and the Keyboard Shortcuts icon. However, it doesn't make it there if zoomed out or the Streams pane is short enough.
Please forgive the typos and grammar. It's been a long day, but I'd still like to help out where I can.

Anders Kaseorg said:

The main problem is consistency. The Subscribe to more streams in the left sidebar, buttons on the left side of the compose box, Press Enter to send on the right side of the compose box, Invite more users in the right sidebar, and the keyboard shortcuts icon in the corner are aligned to five different distances from the bottom.

When we have enough streams and users to put the links in the sidebars at the bottom, should our goal be to have all of these at the same distance from the bottom?
And even when they aren't at the bottom, "Invite more users" and the keyboard should probably have the same distance from the bottom. Screen-Shot-2021-07-14-at-12.04.26-AM.png

One more thing I noticed is that the space below the compose box reduces significantly on expanding the compose box.
Screenshot-from-2021-07-14-22-54-44.png
